org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events
Class TestEventSink

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.services.assertions.events.TestEventSink
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, EventSink
public class TestEventSink
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventSink

Handler for test lifecycle events. This class can register interest in remote events, and subscribe to their lifecycle events. Important: this component does not unsubscribe in its finalizer, because finalizers are so unreliable. Manually unsubscribe() or use unsubscribeQuietly() in the teardown Created 10-Jul-2007 12:23:27 Currently this tool uses simple RMI to register itself. At some point it will need to switch to smartfrog registration when running under a daemon, so that all the security kicks in. Important: be very careful with synchronisation here, because RMI calls come in on different threads. It is easy to deadlock, especially during teardown operations.

startApplication

public StartedEvent startApplication(long timeout)
                              throws SmartFrogException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
Start the application and block until the component reports itself as started. If the component terminates during this time. If the application is not yet deployed, that is done too.

Parameters:
timeout - time in ms to wait
Returns:
the startup event or null if it didn't start
Throws:
SmartFrogException - for deployment problems
TestTimeoutException - if a timeout occurred
TestFailureException - if the component terminated before starting up
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread waiting was interrupted

runTestsToCompletion

public LifecycleEvent runTestsToCompletion(long startupTimeout,
                                           long executeTimeout)
                                    throws SmartFrogException,
                                           java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException
Run the tests to completion, return the lifecycle event

Parameters:
startupTimeout - time to wait in millis for startup
executeTimeout - time to wait in millis for execution
Returns:
the TestCompletedEvent or TerminatedEvent at the end of the run
Throws:
SmartFrogException - deployment problems including timeout
TestTimeoutException - if a timeout occurred
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread waiting was interrupted

Dump the history to a string, one event per line. Used in timeout reports

the history of recevied events.
